numbered_ace_sentences: 1. This graph shows data about optimism about the future.
2. In most countries, the younger generation is more optimistic about the future than the older generation.
3. People who are at least 40 years old are more likely to have experienced hardships in their lives.
4. People who are at least 40 years old are more likely to have experienced trauma in their lives.
5. If a person experiences hardships, then the person can become less optimistic.
6. If a person experiences trauma, then the person can become less optimistic.
7. Older people can see the dark side of society.
8. If a person sees the dark side of society, then the person can become less optimistic.
9. Younger people are more likely to have hopes and dreams.
10. The development of society can increase the hopes and dreams of younger people.
11. A career can increase the hopes and dreams of younger people.
12. Many countries in Africa have an older generation that is very optimistic.
13. Many countries in Africa have a younger generation that is very optimistic.
14. This graph is aimed at teens.
15. This graph is aimed at older generations.
16. This graph can make teens think about why the graph produces these results.
17. This graph can make older generations think about why the graph produces these results.
18. This graph explicitly compares views between different generations and different countries.
19. This graph is a scatter plot.
20. A scatter plot can compare relationships between variables.
21. In this graph, the variables are the older generation and the younger generation.
22. In this graph, the variables also include countries.
23. We can use this graph to see a line.
24. The line divides the overall optimism of the generations.
25. We can reflect on factors behind the data.
